original: Elmqvist, Karl Hiltling, e. provinsialläkare, Tidan, f. 23/4/04 i Fjärås, Hall. 1., av foJkskoll. Johan August E. o. Augusta Mathilda Johansson. G. 40 m. Britta Bergman. Barn: Karin, Birgitta, Kristina. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 23, med. kand. i Lund 29, med. lic. där 34. Tf. prov:läk. i Kungsbacka o. Ullareds distr. kort. tid. 34, as’sist :’läk. o. tf. und :läk. v. Jönköp. las. med. avd. 34-35, andre und:läk. v. Stora Eke-bergs san. 36-37, tf. un.d:läk. v. Var-bergs las. 37, tredje und :läk. v. Nynäs kuranst. s. å., andre 38, und :läk. v. Kristianstads las. med. avd. 38-42, andre und :läk. v. Löwenströmska las. i Uppl. Väsby 42-45, e. prov :läk. i Tidans distr. 45.
translated: Elmqvist, Karl Hiltling, former provincial physician in Tidan, born on April 23, 1904 in Fjärås, Halland, first son of elementary schoolteacher Johan August E. and Augusta Mathilda Johansson. Married in 1940 to Britta Bergman, with whom he had three children: Karin, Birgitta, and Kristina. He received his baccalaureate in Gothenburg in 1923, his medical degree from Lund University in 1929, and his medical license there in 1934. He briefly served as temporary provincial physician in the Kungsbacka and Ullared districts in 1934, was assistant physician and temporary attending physician at Jönköping County Hospital's medical department in 1934-35, second attending physician at Stora Ekeberg's sanatorium in 1936-37, temporary attending physician at Varberg's hospital in 1937, third attending physician at Nynäs Cure Resort in the same year, second attending physician and attending physician at Kristianstad County Hospital's medical department in 1938-42, second attending physician at Löwenström's Hospital in Upplands Väsby from 1942-45, and finally became provincial physician in the Tidan district in 1945.
